dt: {bc}a word referring grammatically to an antecedent
{bc}a thing having a {a_link|relation} to or connection with or necessary dependence on another thing
{bc}a person connected with another by blood or affinity
{bc}an animal or plant {a_link|related} to another by common descent

shortdef: a word referring grammatically to an antecedent
a thing having a relation to or connection with or necessary dependence on another thing
a person connected with another by blood or affinity

dt: {bc}introducing a subordinate clause qualifying an expressed or implied antecedent

dt.t: the {wi}relative{/wi} isolation of life in the country

dt: used of major and minor keys and scales
{bc}expressed as the ratio of the specified quantity (such as an error in measuring) to the total magnitude (such as the value of a measured quantity) or to the mean of all the quantities involved

shortdef: introducing a subordinate clause qualifying an expressed or implied antecedent; also : introduced by such a connective

dt: {bc}the ratio of the amount of water vapor actually present in the air to the greatest amount possible at the same temperature

shortdef: the ratio of the amount of water vapor actually present in the air to the greatest amount possible at the same temperature
with regard to : in connection with

dt: {bc}the motion of the air relative to a body in it

shortdef: the motion of the air relative to a body in it

dt: {bc}someone who has the same parents or ancestors as another person

dt.t: Your sister is your {it}blood relative{/it}, but your brother-in-law is not.

shortdef: someone who has the same parents or ancestors as another person

dt: used to say that something can be thought of in opposite ways depending on what one compares it to

dt.t: The car might seem expensive, but {it}it's all relative{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that something can be thought of in opposite ways depending on what one compares it to
